articles.author: Daniel Reardon, Andrew Zic
articles.title: Using a detector the size of a galaxy, astronomers detect gravitational waves from supermassive black hole pairs - Phys.org
articles.description: When black holes and other enormously massive, dense objects whirl around one another, they send out ripples in space and time called gravitational waves. These waves are one of the few ways we have to study the enigmatic cosmic giants that create them.
